content: design this pattern was inspired by the olive producing region of the istrian peninsula in croatia and the colours of the italy yarn used in the sample the stitch pattern chosen has subtle nods to the traditional oil making process while i have made several samples of this pattern and tested the math repeatedly it has not been through a formal pattern test it does however come with a full youtube tutorial a chart two different border options and a written pattern terminology us terminology is used in this pattern yarn this scarf is made to measure so you can use any weight of yarn you choose the yarn used in the sample was filati tre sfere maia 20% llama and 80% acrylic it comes in 50 grams skeins with 200 meters per skein the full pattern with olive border required just under 2 skeins hook i recommend using the hook size recommended for the yarn you choose or increasing by one size in order to get nice drape for the sample i used a 6mm in-line hook for my chain and a 4mm in-line hook for the rest of the scarf gauge since this pattern is made to measure you do not need to meet gauge in order to complete this pattern
